parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Cheerful, having good courage. From eu and thumos; in fine spirits, i.e. Cheerful.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome. From pros and lambano; to take to oneself, i.e. Use, lead, admit.
Food, nourishment, maintenance. From trepho; nourishment; by implication, rations.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
